name: Somchai
description: Highly skilled culinary artists who specialize in creating flavorful and aromatic Thai dishes.

recipes.name: Green Curry
recipes.cooking_method: In a large saucepan or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the green curry paste and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. Add the meat and stir-fry for a few minutes until browned. Add the coconut milk and stir well to combine. Taste and adjust seasoning with more fish sauce or sugar if needed. If you like your curry spicier, add some chopped red chilies.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
recipes.cooking_method: Soak the rice noodles in warm water for 10-15 minutes, or until they are soft but still slightly firm. Drain and set aside. Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the garlic and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add the drained noodles to the wok and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until they are coated in the oil and heated through. Add the bean sprouts and stir-fry for another minute, or until the bean sprouts are slightly wilted.

recipes.name: Som Tum
recipes.cooking_method: In a large mixing bowl, combine the grated green papaya, halved cherry tomatoes, and cut green beans. Set aside. In the same mortar and pestle, pound the minced garlic and chili peppers until fragrant. Pour the dressing over the green papaya mixture in the mixing bowl. Toss the salad gently to evenly coat the ingredients with the dressing. Taste the salad and adjust the seasoning as needed with more fish sauce, lime juice, or sugar. Serve the Som Tum immediately, garnished with additional chopped peanuts if desired.
